Key Arguments: The legislation will damage free speech, which is a fundamental human right.
The definition of 'misinformation' is subjective, particularly regarding psychological harm.
The bill represents an extreme version of existing restrictions on speech.
The legislation is seen as a betrayal of the freedoms fought for by past generations.
The bill could transform Australia into a dictatorship and deter people from wanting to live there.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a non-negotiable human right and must be safeguarded.
What someone perceives as harmful, another may perceive as helpful.
This bill is a betrayal of all that these brave heroes of the past died fighting for.
